newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Police fire into air to break up Jakarta clash.
newsitem.headline: Police fire into air to break up Jakarta clash.

text.p: Police fired warning shots into the air to break up a clash between rival political groups in Jakarta on Friday, the last day of the campaign for Indonesia's general elections.

Witnesses said the clash involved supporters of the ruling Golkar party who stoned a convoy carrying members of the minority United Development Party (PPP) in the Ciputat district of southern Jakarta.
The witnesses said PPP loyalists reacted and riot police broke up the fight with teargas and rubber bullets.
At least five people were injured after being hit by stones or teargas canisters, the witnesses said.
They said PPP supporters were still throwing stones at police, who were trying to force them off the main thoroughfare.
There were also reports of PPP marchers stoning government buildings in Tanggerang, a town adjoining Jakarta's western outskirts, but there were no further details.
